note: Symmetrical reciprocation that my friend will also consider me their friend is of course simplified - but it will probably work well for inquisitorial sources.

"Associavit" is more "accompanied from place to place", i.e. that associavit cannot replace "habuit in societate sua". This meaning, i.e. accompanying sb from place to place, is systematically the case in GuiSent at least until p. 428.
Et fuit captus pro heresi et non fuit in tempore gratie.

labels.value: was captured outside the period of grace (by sb - [because of st])

note: This is not necessarily an interaction because sometimes blessed food is ate in solitude, therefore "action" and not "interaction".

labels.value: appeared in court (before sb - [because of st])

note: Reciprocal symmetrical relation is not assumed (even if it mostly will be the case that the fight is mutual). But this is the kind of knowledge that should not be in the db but only at the level of query.

Differentiate "includes" for subseting and this general "contains" (e.g.: "this book contains heresies" is not the kind of subsetting that is done with the logical "includes"). The criterion is not 1 vs. 3 epistemological level of statement but whether it is subsetting (> includes) or something more general (> contains).
Sometimes frequency makes sense for belief: there are statements such as "sometimes she believed this and sometimes not."

labels.value: gave oneself (to st/sb) [about conversion, e.g. consolament]

note: Exclusively for actual donation/gift, not just handing over. Note the difference of the general "dedit" (synonym of tradidit) and this.
Based on https://dissinet.slack.com/archives/CK602V6CW/p1585913954002400?thread_ts=1585843979.002000&cid=CK602V6CW, it is important to keep also the dative valency, not just the "coram" valency.
Use A0044 "fatebatur" instead.

Structure where st goes before the optional "to sb" is needed because of correct reciprocation between factus est and fecit (symmetrical slots were needed - I spent 15 minutes pondering upon it). Connected also to the primary semantics of this A/R as "action" and not "interaction".
Frequency can make sense, e.g. for migrating shepherds.

The details concerning time and locations etc. concern the penance, not the action of the penance being given. We can work back to the former from the document data, actant 1, (if present), and time from. The duration column is for the duration of the punishment, e.g. imprisonment or wearing crosses.

The details concerning time and locations etc. concern the penance, not the action of the penance being given. We can work back to the former from the document data, actant 1, (if present), and time from. The duration column is for the duration of the punishment, e.g. imprisonment or wearing crosses.

labels.value: "hereticatus/a fuit" [sc. consecratus/a a hereticis; de rebus]

note: The duration column is for the duration of the punishment, e.g. imprisonment or wearing crosses.
The duration column is for the duration of the punishment, e.g. imprisonment or wearing crosses.
"Fama" is impersonal, so the actant1 will not be the one who diffuses it but the one in front of whom the person is infamatus.
The document has a date and place but the role of a person towards the document does not have any date and place.
"in­quisitionem contra eos facere incepimus" (Guglielmites p. 52)

labels.value: interrogated on trial (by sb - [whether / concerning st])
was led (by sb - in a location)
swore (to/in front of sb - st / to do st)

note: This should not be coded as "audivit" + substatement "somebody read to somebody", because this would mean that he heard that somebody read, and not that he heard somebody reading. Whence this A/R.

Reciprocity: only "locutus" without contra is returned to subject from actant1 because it should imply that he spoke about it with the critic but not necessarily that they criticized the concept/person too.

Obviously there is many kinship rules - perhaps not urgent to list them at this stage. They function in a similar way; all are reciprocal, but some are reciprocal symmetrical (sibling-sibling), other reciprocal asymmetrical (parent-child).
The document has a date and place but the role of a person towards the document does not have any date and place.
actant2 = content of obligation (e.g. punishment, property).
This is usually inferred rather than completely explicit (then, put type nr. 3 in the relevant col.). #Even (sub)group can be part of a group.

labels.value: promised (sb/in front of - st / to do st)

note: location_where = place where remission given, if different from document detail; place_from = place of visitation/stay or prison.

labels.value: was released (by somebody from a punishment)

note: The document and "constitutus in iudicio" has a date and place but the role of a person towards the document does not have any date and place.

labels.value: subject of legal action (for Text part)

note: "Salutavit eos modo communi / modo hereticali": these will be Concepts used as A/R modifiers.
This might be useful for modelling narrative, sequence of actions.

For witnesses of documents (assessors), not deponents!!! The document has a date and place but the role of a person towards the document does not have any date and place. But the assessor's presence at a trial can be restored by a rule - often explicit (interfuerunt ibi testes...).
For going somewhere with somebody, use A0123 "associavit".

labels.value: came, i.e. appeared in court ([before sb])

note: The document has a date and place but the role of a person towards the document does not have any date and place.
Stronger than "corroborates".

Property type = actant1, property value/target = actant2. Some attributes can have time, e.g. someone can be a resident of Milan (or be unmarried and then married) at some time. Location is not allowed: for office of "inquisitor heretice pravitatis" in Lombardy and March of Genoa, a C should be used which already holds this "in Lombardy and March of Genoa", which is a subset of "inquisitor heretice pravitatis" more generally.
The label of A0093 was "has attribute", then "has property", then "has" only (see https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GMAsDJJIa4YuOKwiDLQKt6pSPud71lhUNf3sb6XkGyU/edit# for the history of and reasons for changes).
Only for general relationship pointer where fuller semantics is not possible to make. Mostly avoid.
Stronger than "contradicts".
This is usually inferred rather than completely explicit (then, put type nr. 3 in the relevant col.). #Even (sub)group can be part of a group.
